critique: The document expresses concern and determination regarding labor disputes at Montgomery Ward & Co. during wartime. It aims to justify the government's intervention to ensure the continued operation of essential facilities for the war effort. The primary emotions conveyed are concern (bordering on fear) about the disruption of war production and a sense of urgency and determination to resolve the situation. There's also an element of disgust or disapproval towards Montgomery Ward's refusal to comply with the National War Labor Board's directives. Surprise is not really present.
